titlepage.titleproper: Register of the Mexican Subject Collection, 1918-1998
titlepage.publisher:
Hoover Institution Archives
Stanford University
Stanford, California

defitem.label: Processed by:

titlepage.p: © 1998 Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Mexican Subject Collection,

physdesc.label: Extent
physdesc.extent: 36 manuscript boxes, 3 oversize boxes, 5 microfilm reels, 1 phonorecord, 2 maps

did.abstract: Reports, policy statements, resolutions, bulletins, speeches, agenda, election material, serial issues, pamphlets, and other printed matter, relating to political conditions in Mexico. The collection focuses primarily on communist, socialist and Trotskyist organizations in Mexico, and consists largely of issuances of these organizations (especially the Partido Comunista Mexicano, the Partido Mexicano de los Trabajadores, the Partido Revolucionario de los Trabajadores, and the Partido Socialista Unificado de México) and of trade unions (especially of university workers) from the 1960s through the 1980s.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Mexican subject collection, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1989.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog Socrates at http://library.stanford.edu/webcat. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in Socrates is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

did.unittitle: SUBJECT FILE, 1925-1994.

scopecontent.p: Reports, policy statements, meeting material, election material, contracts, bulletins, clippings, speeches, budgets, press releases, agenda, pamphlets, by-laws, petitions, circulars, printed articles, resolutions, leaflets, serial issues, flyers, lists, forms, and miscellany. Arranged alphabetically by subject.

did.unittitle: OVERSIZE FILE, 1931-1988.

scopecontent.p: Flyers, handbills, and serial issues; primarily Trotskyist and communist publications

did.unittitle: AUDIOVISUAL FILE, 1918-1975.
did.container: Microfilm cabinet, Map cabinet, Record cabinet

scopecontent.p: Five rolls of microfilm, one phonorecord, and two maps showing land ownership in portions of Mexico

dsc.head: Container List
dsc.p: Check card catalog for increments that may have been received after December 1994

Partido Revolucionario de los Trabajadores. NOTE: The PRT resulted from a succession of fusions involving the Grupo Comunista Internacionalista (GCI), the Liga Comunista Internacional (LCI), and the Liga Socialista (LS). In general, material which spans these changes, particularly serials, has been arranged here, while earlier material may also be found under separate headings for the predecessor organizations

Five rolls of microfilm. Serials include El Machete, Tierra, Teoria, La Correspondance Internationale; subjects include education, agrarian issues, and politics in Yucatan. Itemized list available
